I really do like this game.

The classics about the old counter strike.

-Great servers.
-Better hit boxes and guns; Guns arent hyper accurate like in CSS. Killing someone isnt as easy.
-Has the shield. Whether you like it or not, the option I still prefer. 
-Slicker skins I prefer more. I like the skin for some of the characters better than in css.
-WAY better maps and more than CSS. Downed, and the old Assault map, along with many more that were left out or changed in source. Sadly.
-The scout looks personally better to me.
-The guns all dont feel like clones like in source.

It is the least played cs version of all of them and most of people probably haven't even heard about it, welp this was my first counter strike afterall so, it's my first preference out of all the counter strike games available.

[h1]!!Important note!![/h1]
I have only played Counter-strike condition zero Deleted scenes


[u]What I liked about the game[/u]
[list] 
[*]	A surprisingly long campaign. It took me about 9 hours to complete the deleted scenes. 

[*]	 A Large selection of weapons, which are satisfying to use. 

[*]	The missions take place all over the world. You will Join different counter-strike squads from around the world (British, USA, Japanese and Russia). 

[*]	Plenty of gore and violence; Lots of head popping and bodies exploding. 

[*]	The levels are well designed with plenty of hidden secrets. The levels reminded me of the ones in Half-life. 

[*]	Awesome training level; better than half-life‚Äôs and opposing force‚Äôs training level.

[*]	I liked the equipment you got to use, like the welding torch and the optic camera. 

[*]	Good Varity of terrorists to kill; From a machete wielding nutter or a suicide bomber to a gun wielding terrorist. The A.I is also pretty good.      

[*]	Not overly realistic. It‚Äôs not like Rainbow six or Ghost recon, the gameplay is more like half-life. 

[*]	Good soundtrack.          

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]

[*]	Its Shame you can‚Äôt use the iron sights on some of the other weapons, like the M16. 

[*]	There isn‚Äôt really a story. The missions aren‚Äôt connected in any way. Its just different counter strike operations. 

[*]	It‚Äôs a shame you can‚Äôt pick ammo from enemies. 

[*]	Some of the levels are quite short.

[*]	There‚Äôs no memorable protagonists or antagonists. 

[*]	Would have been nice if you could carry your own first aid kit and able to use it anytime you want.  

[u]Conclusion[/u] 

Better than I thought. The single player campaign was longer than I expected. I didn‚Äôt expect much, especially with counter-strike beginning more focused on online multiplayer.  You get three games; counter-strike, counter-strike condition zero and counter-strike condition zero deleted scenes. If you like military types games or half-life, then I highly recommend you play this game. I wish they would introduce a single player Campaign into the later games.  

[h1]8/10[/h1]

An internet cafe game classic.

I prefer CS:Source over this because it's CS:CZ with an updated engine but still have that CS 1.6 feeling.

But, it still had a great campaign, so play it!

[b]Intro[/b]
Note: This is a review of the Deleted Scenes campaign only. The content/replayability score does take in other modes however.

[b]The Great:[/b]
++N/A

[b]The Good:[/b]
+Sound design's actually somewhat decent with some really punchy weapon effects and half-decent environmental effects
+There's something oddly enjoyable about Gold Source's engine despite its annoying quirks. I honestly can't put my finger on it, but I'm sure plenty of people can relate.
+There's some bonus levels outside of the campaign
+The combat isn't totally without its' merits

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal:[/b]
+-The devs actually managed to do some impressive things with the engine. Animating dead bodies to look like true ragdoll as in other games for one, and animating crumpling paper and crushing boxes for some more. I don't know how they managed to do some of it on the engine, but it actually does a good job of mimicking
real physics. It absolutely doesn't save this game's presentation, though.
-+The voice acting isn't the worst thing in the world but it's certainly not good, and the phony accents don't help

[b]The Bad:[/b]
-If you're below 25 health, all you can really do is pray to the RNG gods that both the enemy will decide to miss you and that your weapons will be accurate, which aren't often the case. So sometimes you'll go around a corner and die over and over until you get lucky and the enemies decide to miss and your bullets
decide to hit where you're aiming.
-Hit detection is awful, and I know I'm not mistaking it for inaccurate weaponry
-Reload animations are annoyingly long
-Movement is as slippery as Half-Life's, but much slower. Given how many thin ledges and platforming is required from you, I have to wonder who thought giving the character roller-skates was a good idea.
-The campaign is very short. Under 4 hours even on Hard. There are some bonus maps, however.
-Enemy placement is BS sometimes, but especially on the last level
-There is no story. There are settings and objectives for each level, but they're totally self-contained.
-It's barely a challenge for at least half the game, but then the enemy placements get more annoying and it starts kicking your butt some more
-Music's forgettable
-The stealth sections work about as well as you'd expect on this engine. Thankfully, they're rare and cheese-able.
-There's a really annoying glitch where loading a save makes you fire automatically until you press the fire button yourself. It got me killed many times.
-The FOV is too small and can't be changed

[b]The Horrible:[/b]
--This game came out in 2004... two thousand and fucking four. Yet, it barely looks better than the original Half-Life, which ALREADY looked out of date 6 years ago! To compare this game visually to Half-Life 2, Doom 3, Thief Deadly Shadows, or, you know, ANY game released in 2004, is like comparing the U.S. healthcare
to any other first-world country -- it's nothing but a laughing stock.
--Counter-Strike's trademark nonsensical, ridiculous recoil system made playing this more and more annoying. It's often up to RNG as to whether you'll actually hit anything thanks to random weapon spread mixed with strong recoil. Sometimes you can get two easy headshots without a problem, and sometimes you'll miss
even with your crosshair clearly right on their head and even shots point blank at their body. It's just absurd.
--Incredibly repetitive. Shoot similar types of braindead enemies over and over while planting a bomb or pulling out a gadget every now and then.

Sound: 5.5/10
Graphics: 2/10
Gameplay: 4/10
Content/Replayability: 8/10
Overall: 4.5/10

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Not a dreadful experience, but I can't recommend it. Good for a nostalgia trip if you played this at the time, or just to kill a few hours, but that's about it. I'm sure you have better things to do and games to waste your life on. I don't, that's why I bothered to finish it.

Probably the best age of empires game (In my opinion)
- Always good to come back to an old classic,
- Wide range of Civs to play and game mode options
- Only real down side to this game is that the mutiplayer is extremly laggy even with a good pc, fps ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• it's self when you do a 8, May not help that i like the pop at 500 but what can you do :')

I like this game. My complaint is that the campaign with your choices of troops, and you have to complete the challenges is WAY, WAY too damn hard. The bots in the game are always so perfectly accurate 99 percent of the time they kill you with a headshot. If you are lucky, bots will hit you a little lower than your head, giving you barely enough health to stay alive. I like the game overall, but my problem is really just the bots and their difficulty. 6/10
